title: Calories in Vodka Per Shot
meta_description: Discover calories in vodka per shot, including alcohol content, zero carbs, and nutrition breakdowns for standard 80-proof servings.
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) shot of 80-proof (40% ABV) plain vodka; no mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, and serving size; alcohol content affects calorie density. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard shot of 80-proof vodka contains ~96 kcal, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in vodka per shot?
faqs.a: About 96 kcal for a standard 1.5 fl oz shot of 80-proof vodka.

faqs.q: Does vodka have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Plain vodka has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars—all calories come from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in vodka?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more calories; e.g., 100-proof adds ~24 kcal per shot vs. 80-proof.

faqs.q: Are there any nutrients in vodka besides calories?
faqs.a: No protein, fat, cholesterol, or sodium; it's essentially empty calories from ethanol.

faqs.q: What about calories in vodka with mixers?
faqs.a: Mixers like soda or juice add significant carbs and sugars—stick to plain for lowest calories.
